title: Prince William breaks rank and becomes the first British royal to don a traditional sherwani
text:
He’s normally more accustomed to pristine Savile Row suits by Gieves & Hawkes or trusty chinos with standard blue shirts and desert boots, but Prince William drew the flashbulbs away from his wife during the couple’s tour of Pakistan today in a traditional jewel-toned sherwani.

The dark teal ensemble, featuring an intricately embroidered collar and cuffs, worn with matching trousers, was designed by Naushemian, a Karachi-based label which has outfitted the Duchess of Cambridge during the tour. And while the future queen glittered in sequinned, forest-green Jenny Packham during a tuk tuk ride in Islamabad, it was the normally conservative Prince William that for once prompted a reaction for his...
description: He’s normally more accustomed to pristine Savile Row suits by Gieves & Hawkes or trusty chinos with standard blue shirts and desert boots, but Prince William drew the flashbulbs away from his wife during the couple’s tour of Pakistan today in a traditional jewel-toned sherwani.
